document.masterDocTitle: Morphological revision of the Subgroup 1 Fauchald, 1970 of Marphysa de Quatrefages, 1865 (Eunicidae: Polychaeta)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Morphological revision of the Subgroup 1 Fauchald, 1970 of Marphysa de Quatrefages, 1865 (Eunicidae: Polychaeta)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Marphysa gemmata
Mohammad, 1973 :32
–34, Figs. 4–5 ;
Katsiaras et al. 2014
:211
–213, Figs. 8a–d , 9a–d , Tab. 2 .

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Material examined.
Type material:
Holotype BNHM 1971.49 , Al-Dbaiyyah , Kuwait , Arabian Gulf ,
9 May 1969
, 28°57’ N 48°11’ E , in sand, intertidal, coll. M. B. Mohammad.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 38.
Paucibranchia gemmata (Mohammad, 1973)
n. comb.
, holotype BNHM 1971.49. A. Anterior end, dorsal view; B. Anterior end, ventral view; C. Anterior end with branchiae, dorsal view; D. Dorsal cirri in posterior region, ventral view. Scale bars: A, B, C, D, 1.5 mm.

FIGURE 39.
Paucibranchia gemmata (Mohammad, 1973)
n. comb.
, holotype BNHM 1971.49. A. Maxillary apparatus, dorsal view; B. Left MI-II-III-IV-V, dorsal view; C. Attachment lamellae of MIV, ventral view; D. Mandibles. Scale bars: A, 0.5 mm; B, C, 0.2 mm; D, 0.36 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Holotype incomplete, dried, with 160 chaetigers, L10= 5.9 mm , W10= 1 mm , the fragment with TL= 51 mm . Anterior region of body with convex dorsum, and flat ventrum, without groove; body depressed from chaetiger 6, widest at chaetiger 92, tapering after chaetiger 136.

Prostomium in poor condition, entire, 0.8 mm long, 1.2 mm wide, frontally rounded, without median sulcus ( Fig. 38A ), ventral sulcus deep ( Fig. 38B ). Prostomial appendages in a semicircle, median antenna equidistant. Palps reaching first chaetiger; right lateral antennae broken, left lateral antennae reaching second chaetiger; median antennae reaching four chaetiger. Palpophores and ceratophores ring-shaped, short, thick; palpostyles and ceratostyles tapering, thick, without articulation. Eyes absent.
Peristomium wider than prostomium ( 1 mm long, 1.5 mm wide), first ring two times longer than second ring, separation between rings distinct on all sides ( Fig. 38A–B ). Inferior lip broken.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 40.
Paucibranchia gemmata (Mohammad, 1973)
n. comb.
, holotype BNHM 1971.49. A. Parapodium 4, dorsal cirri with bent tip, postchaetal lobe broken; B. Parapodium 16; C. Parapodium 31; D. Parapodium 50; E. Parapodium 105. All in anterior view. Scale bars: A, D, E, 0.15 mm; B, 0.22 mm; C, 0.48 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Maxillary apparatus with MF= 1+1, 8+8, 7+0, 7+9, 1+1 ( Fig. 39A ). Maxillary carriers 2.1 times shorter than length of MI. MI forceps-like; closing system 10.5 times shorter than length of MI; ligament between MI and
MII
slightly sclerotized ( Fig. 39A–B )
.
MII
wide
;
teeth curved, cavity opening oval 4 times shorter than length of
MII
;
ligament between
MII
and MIII , and right MIV , slightly sclerotized ( Fig. 39A–B )
. MIII short;
with triangular teeth; with attachment lamella slightly sclerotized ( Fig. 39A–B ). Left MIV with small basal teeth; attachment lamella triangular, wide, situated 1/2 along length of posterior edge of maxilla, slightly sclerotized. Right MIV with teeth of similar size; attachment lamella slender, semicircular, better developed in the middle, situated 1/3 along length of posterior edge of maxilla ( Fig. 39A–C ). MV square, with a short rounded tooth ( Fig. 39A–B ). Mandibles dark; cutting plates whitish, with 18 growth rings ( Fig. 39D ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 41.
Paucibranchia gemmata (Mohammad, 1973)
n. comb.
, holotype BNHM 1971.49. A. Compound falciger, long blade, chaetiger 16; B. Compound falciger, median blade, chaetiger 16; C. Compound falciger, short blade, chaetiger 16; D. Compound falciger, short blade, chaetiger 149; E. Subacicular hook, chaetiger 50. Scale bars: A, 39 µm; B, 29 µm; C, 25 µm; D, E, 20 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. The specimen studied here is the only record that has been found of this species.
Katsiaras et al. (2014)
commented that they did not observe pectinate chaetae in the posterior chaetigers, and this peculiar condition is confirmed here.

Paucibranchia gemmata
n. comb.
resembles
P. adenensis
n. comb .
,
P. conferta
n. comb.
,
P. patriciae
n. sp.
and
Paucibranchia
sp. 2 in the translucent color of subacicular hooks and bidentate form, and the presence of only compound falcigers.
However, P. gemmata
n. comb.
is different because it has dorsal cirri two times longer in the postbranchial region; whereas in all previous species dorsal cirri are of the same size in pre- and postbranchial regions. In addition,
P. gemmata
n. comb.
has falcigers with blades of three sizes in anterior chaetigers; whereas
P. adenensis
n. comb.
and
Paucibranchia
sp. 2 only have falcigers with blades of two size, and in
P. patriciae
n. sp.
all blades are of similar size. Finally, the aciculae are translucent in
P. gemmata
n. comb.
; whereas in
P. conferta
n. sp.
are reddish on the basal end and translucent distally. The comparison with other
Paucibranchia
n. gen.
species having only compound falcigers present is provided in Table 2 .
